com.tianscar.awt.x11

Class ColorfulXCursor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tianscar.awt.x11.ColorfulXCursor

  • public final class ColorfulXCursor
extends java.lang.Object
    The ColorfulXCursor factory class to create X cursors

    • Method Detail

      • createImageCursor

        public static java.awt.Cursor createImageCursor(java.awt.Image cursor,
                                                java.awt.Point hotSpot,
                                                java.lang.String name)
                                         throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                                java.awt.HeadlessException
        Creates a new image cursor object. If the image to display is invalid, the cursor will be hidden (made completely transparent), and the hotspot will be set to (0, 0).

        Note that multi-frame images are invalid and may cause this method to hang.

        Parameters:
        cursor - the image to display when the cursor is activated
        hotSpot - the X and Y of the large cursor's hot spot; the hotSpot values must be less than the Dimension returned by java.awt.Toolkit.getBestCursorSize
        name - a localized description of the cursor, for Java Accessibility use
        Returns:
        the colorful image cursor, or the original 2-color image cursor if isARGBSupported() returns false
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the hotSpot values are outside the bounds of the cursor
        java.awt.HeadlessException - if GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true
        See Also:
        GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless()

      • getFontCursor

        public static java.awt.Cursor getFontCursor(int type)
                                     throws java.awt.HeadlessException
        Gets font cursor object by type.
        Parameters:
        type - the font cursor type
        Returns:
        the font cursor, or the default cursor if there's no cursor could be found by the type
        Throws:
        java.awt.HeadlessException - if GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true
        See Also:
        XCreateFontCursor, GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless()

      • getLibraryCursor

        public static java.awt.Cursor getLibraryCursor(java.lang.String name)
                                        throws java.awt.HeadlessException
        Gets library cursor object by name.
        Parameters:
        name - the library cursor name
        Returns:
        the library cursor, or the default cursor if there's no cursor could be found by the name
        Throws:
        java.awt.HeadlessException - if GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true
        See Also:
        XcursorLibraryLoadCursor, GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless()

      • isARGBSupported

        public static boolean isARGBSupported()
        Returns whether current display supports ARGB-colored cursor
        Returns:
        true if ARGB-colored cursor is supported by current display, false not
